column4: I am an old MS user and I can't figure out how to install anything on Ubuntu unless it's in the software center.
I think Linux is for programming professionals only.
I downloaded the deb packages then double clicked on them... it asked for a location so I gave C:\Helix then it did nothing except copy it's files there.
It didn't install.
there is no c:\ on linux
Oh, well it said it made one...
Brontoeee. I just want to be able to watch movies on my computer.
Can't find a way to do that.
what kind of movies? what are their extensions? online movies (give the example url?)?
Just rented movies. I can watch anything I rent on Windows.
I want to learn LINUX but it's very difficult.
DVDs?
Brontoeee, no I haven't, I just supposed that a video player on Ubuntu would have the necessary codecs.
Brontoeee, yes, DVD's
just install vlc, that should do the trick, i think it is in the repos
Brontoeee, why can't I install Real's deb player in UBUNTU?
I will look for vlc. Thanks.
why realplayer? i dont think realplayer can play dvds
Sure it can,
Even quicktime.
does quicktime have a LINUX version?
not that i know of
